sentences.en: Exert thy voice, sweet harbinger of spring!
sentences.cn: 敞开嗓门吧, 春天甜美的使者!

sentences.en: He initiated the harbinger of Greek philosophy research from heaven to earth.
sentences.cn: 他开创了古希腊哲学研究从天上到人间的先河.

sentences.en: I am afraid I am not altogether a harbinger of good.
sentences.cn: 恐怕我还不是个传布佳音的天使.

sentences.en: It was an ominous harbinger of species.
It'slowly drew nearer, with each day bringing a new harbinger of its coming.
sentences.cn: 它一天一天地慢慢走近, 每天都带来一些新的气象.

sentences.en: Money held by households and firms is contracting - a harbinger of disinflation and slump.
sentences.cn: 家庭和商户所持有的现金在缩水,这预示着通货紧缩和经济萧条.

sentences.en: Stagflation can be a harbinger of economic depression.
sentences.cn: 景气不好、通货膨胀可能是经济衰退的预兆.

sentences.en: The cock is the harbinger of dawn.
The crow of the cock is a harbinger of dawn.
The cuckoo is a harbinger of spring.
sentences.cn: 布谷鸟预告春天的来临.

sentences.en: The cuckoo is the harbinger of spring.
sentences.cn: 布谷鸟的歌声预示春天的到来.

sentences.en: The November air stung my cheeks, a harbinger of winter.
sentences.cn: 11月的空气刺痛了我的脸颊，预示着冬天就要来临。

sentences.en: The robin is a harbinger of spring.
sentences.cn: 知更鸟是春天的报信者.

sentences.en: The sword is a harbinger of enmity and bitterness.
sentences.cn: 刀剑预示着仇恨和痛苦.

sentences.en: Without that change, the resolution of crisis can only be the harbinger of the next.
sentences.cn: 不做出这一改变, 这场危机的解决只能预示着下一场危机的到来.

trans.tran_en: a sign that something is going to happen soon
